Description: Head from a terracotta figure celebrant. The head of a woman broken from a figure: shortish hair, worn in curls over the forehead; behind and above are the remains of a large wreath, most of which is lost. Hollow; two-piece mould. Red-brown Nile silt with some mica; matt red-brown slip. The break at the neck has been smoothed in modern times and a hole bored through to fit the head to a stand.
Curator's comments: BM Terracotta IV Comparandum. Near: Fischer 1994: no. 1022, dated end of first century ad. Bibliog. Pococke 1743: 213, pl. lxiv:C (the wreath illustrated there is now largely broken away).
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3172)
Condition: Much of wreath lost. The back of the head is broken away.
